Review Text: Unfortunately have to give a 1 star rating due to a very serious issue. On the second night of our stay, 19/12/2025, my partner and I attended the Nayala beach club where we both had a few drinks and some food. Within an hour, I started to feel extremely unwell and ended up requiring a doctor to attend our suite. It was discovered that I had methanol poisoning which can result in death if left untreated. Thankfully the doctor was able to reverse the poisoning and I am now doing ok although I am still struggling to keep food down and am still experiencing dizziness, abdominal discomfort and nausea. When we informed a staff member and then a manager, all we were told is ‚Äúoh we are sorry‚Äù we then tried to escalate this to IHG and received the same response. UNACCEPTABLE! You have had a hotel patron pay an expensive amount for a suite and high costs for beverages and food at your hotel that has caused quite a serious, potentially fatal, illness and all that can be said is ‚Äúsorry‚Äù? No! Other than that the location is beautiful, staff are very nice and helpful and the suite was nice. Although, be warned about the food as it‚Äôs often not fully cooked and there was a few issues in the suite with it seeming quite outdated, couldn‚Äôt watch tv or connect phones for Netflix etc. will not be returning to any IHG resorts or hotels. We thought that a 5 star rating hotel would have a higher standard. We do wish to say thank you to Reni at the spa who was lovely. Do better IHG. Legal advice is currently being sought as to our options.

We had breakfast there üòã Rita was very helpful and showed us the buffet breakfast, it was well presented and tasty. Plenty of choice , the fresh juice was excellent. The service team were efficient and friendly without being in your face all the time. A good experience we will be back !

As expected of the flagship hotel of the IHG brand, Intercontinental Bali Sanur was a beautiful luxurious resort to enjoy a segment of our relaxing vacation. My partner and I are Balinese and Australian respectively, and through our combined set of standards we would definetly stay again if we happen to be around Sanur. Looking forward to seeing the renovated reception/lobby when we do return üôè

Great hotel for couples. Staff was friendly, rooms were spacious and the breakfast was quite tasty. Location is great and we particularly liked the small (kiddy) pools to enjoy in the hot days with great ambience. Location is also great to jog on the beach alley or welcome the sunrise early in the morning. Quite close to Sanur port too. Their Pier Eight restaurant however is lacklustre. Cocktails were not well made (e.g. mojito was lacking crushed ice and sugar).

Everything about the place was perfect, from the rooms to the food but especially the service. The staff are always smiling and so friendly. The villas were exceptional value. They were huge, clean and had a great size private pool. I would highly recommend staying here and look forward to coming back again.

We loved the spacious and clean rooms. The staff were very friendly and always went above and beyond to help. However, breakfast could be improved. There wasn‚Äôt much variety or local cuisine offered. This hotel may not be ideal for families with kids. The kids club was quite disappointing, the staff were unfriendly and unengaging, and there wasn‚Äôt much for the children to do. The kids‚Äô pool was also very basic with no fun features or activities. Overall, great rooms and service, but not family-friendly.

We loved our time at IC Sanur. We were welcomed with cold towels, refreshments, and warm smiles. We had connecting rooms for our family of five. The rooms were very spacious with huge lanais overlooking the inner courtyard area. The staff even had a small birthday cake for our youngest son in the refrigerator. The breakfast buffet was a big plus as well. Many delicious options of various types of food. We look forward to our next stay!

Disappointing stay. Our pool villa was run down and far away from the beach and pool/restaurant so we had to walk for a long time. You can call for a buggy to pick you up but it was inconvenient. Two level boring villa, all views were to see other villas around you. Didn't have any furniture by the pool to sit on apart from one round lounger that didn't even had a cushion to sit on so we asked for a cushion on arrival. It was very uncomfortable so we didnt use it. Walls around the pool were covered in green and black mould. Cleaning standard wasn't great, we had splashes of purple shampoo on shower walls from previous visitors. Water was pouring our of the shower on the floor into the bathroom as it wasn't draining well. Our booking was including breakfast, afternoon tea and afternoon cocktails. When we arrived for our free afternoon tea we were told that there was a mistake in our booking and they won't provide it. After a conversation with a duty manager and our request for a full refund of our 5 nights stay, they provided afternoon tea to us but also charged for it in the final bill so we had to have another conversation. Received a fruit plate on arrival but sadly half of it was rotten. A plate with cakes was nice. Asked for a late check out to 2pm and they gave it us but our swipe cards didn't work when we arrived to our villa at 1.30pm. We only had half an hour to pack and get ready but wasted 10min walking back to reception and catching a buggy back to villa with activated swipe card. Beach at the front of the hotel isn't nice due to a large number of boats in that particular side of the beach and seaweed so you have to walk to another beach to swim. Breakfast at Layang Layand was nice but Pier Eight restaurant was average. They also don't have enough loungers by the pool for a big hotel like this.

saya mendapatkan late check out sampai dengan jam 2 siang. Betapa terkejutnya ketika seorang staff pria langsung masuk ke dalam kamar untuk mengecek mini bar dengan master key tanpa permisi mengetuk pintu ataupun adanya telp pemberitahuan dari front office sebelumnya. Sangat kecewa untuk pelayanan hotel bintang 5. Bagaimana bisa seorang staff masuk ke dalam kamar tamu tanpa permisi sebelumnya dengan master key, padahal tamunya jelas belum check out & belum mengembalikan kunci?? Langsung masuk ke dalam kamar tamu tanpa permisi dengan master key sangat amat tidak sopan.

The villa is so spacious and beautiful. I do understand what people say about a musty smell but its an old room and could be overlooked. If the room wasn't so old it wouldn't have so much space. Hotel was very clean. Breakfast was delicious, try their pancakes!! The beach wasn't super clean/swimmable but great view. Very walkable as well to other spots and very kid friendly.

Great experience in this hotel! The staff were all friendly, and the welcome drinks were also great. My friends and I are a party of four, so we got a two bedroom villa with a garden view and a private pool. The villa was two floors, and to my recollection it was 310m^2. It was an amazing experience. Breakfast was included in our stay, and it was great if you're more inclined to a Western diet. I personally prefer an Asian diet, but the food still tasted great. We had complimentary gym access 24/7 and also a free flow happy hour during 5-7PM. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. When we were checking out, the staff members also made sure we didn't leave anything behind. We also traveled back and forth from the villa to the resort's lobby via buggy. Fun ride! The villa included a kitchen, dining area and a living room which you can connect bluetooth with ;) I was also pretty loud at our villa but no complaints. We also had a sunbed, and it was perfectly aligned with where the sun shined. Great stay, couldn't recommend it enough.

Pasilitas lumayan, Namun Security yang pakai baju biru,rambutnya naik kayak janggar ayam.Sangat tidak mencerminkan sosok Security, parahnya lagi kata-katanya agak cabul.Selama menginap di sini,saya merasa kurang aman.Caranya dia membantu saya, terkesan sok berkuasa.Securitynya ini kayak preman pasar,tidak ada tampang aman atau nyaman. Malah bikin saya gak nyaman dan kata katanya agak menusuk.Intinya saya bayar mahal disini harusnya dapat pelayanan yang sesuai bukan seperti ini. Saat malam ada suara ribut-ribut,bukanya di tindak tegas,dan malah saya yang di suruh sabar.Pantainya banyak lumut,saya lihat security-nya melamun gak jelas.Saat situasi urgent security-nya yang baju biru asik sekali duduk sambil main hp. Saya berharap hotel ini supaya management nya di perbaiki terutama security-nya.Dengan biaya hotel yang mahal,saya minta tolong cek cctv malah ngaku nggak bisa playback emang security makan gajih buta. Dari segi pakaian sudah tidak mencerminkan sebagai petugas keamanan yang tertib,symbol pelatihan keamanan nggak ada.Jangan-jangan security abal-abal masuk lewat orang dalam.Kepolisian kurang tegas dalam melaksanakan pengawasan, penting untuk kedepannya tingkah laku dan perbuatan security-nya secara tidak langsung akan merusak nama baik hotel dan sekitarnya.Penting untuk melaksanakan pembinaan terutama bagian SDM atau HRD supaya tidak asal asalan memilih orang efek nya tidak sekarang tapi kedepannya

A Very Disappointing Stay ‚Äì Doesn‚Äôt Deserve 5 Stars I stayed in a suite, and this was honestly one of my worst hotel experiences ‚Äî definitely not up to the InterContinental standard. ‚Ä¢ Broken AC: The air conditioning was completely out of service. They provided multiple standing fans instead, turning the room into an electronics shop. The humidity was unbearable ‚Äî it literally felt like a sauna near the bed. Even the in-room snacks turned soft and soggy from the damp air, almost like dough. ‚Ä¢ Poor Sound Insulation: At night, I could hear wind whistling through the balcony door, footsteps from the floor above, and constant water pipe noises that made it hard to sleep. ‚Ä¢ Room Dining: The food was far below average and did not reflect 5-star quality in any way. ‚∏ª üö´ Bottom Line: The hotel is very outdated and not worthy of its 5-star rating ‚Äî 3 stars at best. It was a terrible experience, and the only compensation offered was a cheap chocolate cake worth no more than $4. This property seriously damages the InterContinental brand and should be removed from the group altogether.

What a disappointment after staying at Intercontinental Jimbaran. From White Lotus vibes to White Castle vibes! The location is very good and Pier 8 restaurant and staff are the highlights. As for the rest, here goes: As for our room, our bed linen wasn't changed at all. There was some blood on our sheets and comforter cover (small amount) due to an injury and instead of changing the sheets, the bed was simply made and not changed. Secondly, we used some mini fridge items and these weren't replaced. There was also hair found on the shower floor that wasn't cleaned up, indicating the shower itself wasn't cleaned. Lastly, we used glasses from the room and these were just left in the room unwashed and un changed. Having breakfast in the dining room as like being in childcare hell. Screaming kids, sub par food & rude guests who just love to cut in was the norm for each day there. Lastly, the check out process took nearly 30 minutes (don't be in a rush to get to the airport). Even then, I ended up getting a phone call from the front desk whilst in the cab to the airport saying they had forgotten something that required my signature. I found this to be a totally unacceptable level of service from what purports to be a 5 star resort. Next time I'll be staying at the Hyatt Regency nearby.

This is a great hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are a fantastic size. We booked a suite which is around 130 sqm. Breakfast is great and I feel they really ensure their is not too much waste created by having live stations and a la carte orders. The pool is a 50 m one and raised to oversee the promenade and ocean. You get a lovely breeze without having passerby looking at you which happens at the other hotels down the road.

Did not feel like this property lived up to Inter-Con and 5 star standard. Place is kind of old, and rooms had a faint old woodish smell that was not so pleasant. Sheets and pillows also were thin and had a smell. Phone in the room was faulty, asked for follow up but there was none. Gym water dispenser ran out of water. Teams were friendly, but lacking a thoughtfulness on services.

Beautiful scenery, very friendly staff. Love the ambiance. Beach is only walking distance. While you waiting in lobby, you will be serenade by live traditional Balinese gamelan, synchronize with gentle breeze. One of the best hotel in Sanur. For more great reviews, please follow me üëâ ig @sitivibes ‚ú®üí´üå∑üå∫ ‚Ä¶

I will start with the good things - the grounds are amazing and the rooms are spacious and beautiful. But the maintenance is not so good. In our room we had this impressive bathtub, only to discover that all the water from it leaks right away on the floor. And the hotel couldn‚Äôt do anything to fix it. The housekeeping was forgetting to put new towels and robes (while taking the old ones). Out of three days we were there, one day the pool and the bar next to it were closed for guests because of the wedding, we were not expecting this and would booked another hotel if we knew that. Also technically it was closed only from 3pm, starting from 8-30 am the entrance to the pool was blocked by the decorations that the staff was cutting and drilling and painting with smelly paint. The sea is not really swimmable, so pool access is a really big deal. On the next day another wedding was taking place, and while they didn‚Äôt rented the pool, there was hardly a place in the hotel where you couldn‚Äôt hear the MC and the music. The spa is a complete scam, as the person doing manicure has absolutely no experience - overpainted and underpainted nails, mushy polish that doesn‚Äôt dry, had to come back to remove the polish i paid 500K for few hours later. In the essence, it was once a wonderful place, but if you expect 5star service, go somewhere else.

I find it hard to believe I‚Äôm staying in an intercontinental hotel. Compared to the many other intercon properties I have stayed at this is an extremely poor representation of the brand. I assumed it must have been a rebranded property but upon enquiring I was told it has always been an intercontinental hotel. The build is very poor quality. The service was somehow the most disinterested I have experienced in Bali and that was across the property. Most of the menu items I tried to order were unavailable, the breakfast restaurant was good (probably the only aspect of the property at intercontinental standard) however the offering was very small. The pool bar and pool area is 3* at best. Decking is dilapidated and the grounds are underwhelming. Several of the bathrooms were flooded, around both vanity‚Äôs and toilets. Having come from intercontinental Bali resort jimbaran the difference is night & day. We ate at pier 8 and to say it was underwhelming is to be polite. Under cooked / raw seafood, undercooked steak, woefull desserts. I just can‚Äôt stop repeating that I can‚Äôt understand how this is an 5* intercontinental hotel.

Great hotel! Spacious, bright rooms with a cozy atmosphere - you can feel that everything is thought out to the smallest detail. Very tasty breakfasts! The staff is incredibly helpful and always ready to help, it feels like you‚Äôre at home, not just in a hotel. The location is also good - the beach is within easy reach. The atmosphere is very calm and relaxing, ideal for both recreation. Perhaps the best accommodation option in Sanur, definitely!

This was the second business workshop I have run at the Intercontinental Sanur Bali , it was again exceptional venue , the staff were incredible, such a pleasure to deal with ! The gold star goes to Feggy who I dealt with for the second time and she is a pure joy to deal with and an incredible person, she was looking after all my needs as well as juggling a Wedding at the same time , which the weather was being a pain! She was unbelievable and just so calm and hilarious, I can highly recommend the IC Sanur and you have to use Feggy. I hope the IC realize how much of an asset she truly is ! Back next year! Btw the food was divine Stuart

Great rooms, great service. Great pool, great staff. Breakfast is amazing. Be prepared to walk quite a distance to the pool from your room. Great view but Sanur beach is filthy, alot of rubbish which is quite disappointing. Our first day here , we wanted the pool, but alas , a wedding was taking place , sooo pool was out of bounds. We were quite annoyed as this is what we want to do on our holiday ( swim and sunbake)Thus thought we'd go to beach , sun-baked and swim. But was too disgusting.

Hotel location is at the edge of sanur beach. Not the best. Building needs major renovations, aging and doesnt have the 5 stars needs. No club house, limited space/layout. Villa section is more like abandoned housing complex that turned into 'villa'. Garden conditions just aging and in a mess. They need more staff and major renovation. I give one star for the service of the Balinese staff that working hard for this hotel. Intercontinental known for their quality and im wondering why this hotel, facilities, building conditions still rated as 5 star intercontinental hotel. Owner and top management should understand that intercontinental has a better standard. Look closer:intercontinental jimbaran, they are at their best. Thank you staff but the owner needs to do something for 5 star hotel.

The Hotel was a very lovely end to our beautiful Bali holiday. Many times in Bali, First time in Sanur =Wow! Start off with the room- absolutely breathtaking views , very large and room for little man to stretch his legs. Large bath tub! comfy bed! Dining over the duration of our stay was a huge highlight! The menu in all restaurants had plenty of options. Both dinner services, not only did the staff check in how our meals were, amazing service, the chef also came to greet us, checking if we were satisfied! Thank you Ben!! More than satisfied. Travelling with a toddler- menu options for the kids(nuggets and the rest) had plenty of options. This one is for families travelling with babies-- 2 pureed options!! Big tick! This should be available at all hotels for those travelling with young ones. I wish we had these options travelling when little man was younger . Only downside is the pool area has one big pool and 2 smaller pools- more shade would be nice and maybe perhaps in the near future- kids pool with a slide or 2 üòâ cocktails and happy hours tho always a big tick! Kids Club is absolutely 5 stars. Mine didn't want to leave the entire day- the staff were amazing! Thank you !!

I'm a bit disappointed with the room. I went here when it's still Fairmont and i was impressed with luxurious and spacious room. I expected the same since the price of the room is > IDR 4mio. However quite surprised to see the quality is not the same. The room layout is still the same but it really needs a refurbishment! The sanitary wears are not shining, full of waterstains. The shower is not in perfect condition, and it took so long until the water getting warm (and not even hot). The kettle looks cheap and they dont even have a proper coffee machine nor good coffee sachets. There was unpleasanr smells came from the aircon. But the staff and operational manager handled the complaint properly and moved me to another room (which still have problem with the water not getting hot). But i do appreciate the staff response and apologized sincerely. They even extended my check out to 4PM. The breakfast quality is still good though. Advice to the management to pay attention to the details and cleanliness as it's a 5 stars hotel, they need to provide proper amenities and facilities to match the 5 stars claim.

Location Great location on Sanur beach. View of the ocean from the swimming pool. Walkway along the ocean with several establishments. Short walk into town with a variety of restaurants, massage parlors, laundry service, markets etc. Service The staff were always respectful and eager to help. Service was great. While we were in the Lobby restaurant enjoying a welcome drink and Cocktails, the Manager (Mauro) stopped by our table and visited with us. He shared a bit about his background and the plans he has for the property. That was a rather nice personal touch and it was obvious that he cared to provide good service and visit with the guests to check in on how things are going. Room Got upgraded to a suite (garden view) that was rather nice. The room was bigger than most apartments! The bathroom was very spacious with 2 sinks, a full sized bathtub and a shower. There was a huge balcony with a couple of ceiling fans that provided an outside area where one can spend evenings playing cards and such activities. The room itself was quite spacious with a King size bed. The only complaint would be that it was hard to get the temperature right in the room. But overall, the room and upgrade were fabulous! Lobby restaurant This is the only place we ate. There is a beach side restaurant as another choice but we did not eat there. We had breakfast most mornings at this one. Practically every item we ordered off the menu was exceptional both in presentation and taste. Overall high marks for the quality of food. There is a grand Piano at this restaurant and on the Friday night, not long after we arrived there, there was an Artiste playing the Piano and it was simply fabulous. The ambiance, the food, the music all made for a most enjoyable evening. As wonderful as the Piano was, at other times, little kids constantly kept going up to the Piano and playing on it. This was quite annoying and the staff should have been more insistent that parents do not let their kids take over the Piano without permission. Even after we complained to the staff they seemed reluctant to keep the kids away from the Piano. There is a restaurant directly below the lobby that was being renovated. There was constant noise of construction from this place and quite often a nuisance when one is trying to enjoy a meal. It was impossible to find a time when it was mostly quiet without construction noise. Swimming Pool Spent considerable amount of time at the pool. The pool is quite large and ideal. Plenty of seating around the pool and staff that are eager to help with food or drink orders. Fabulous ocean view from the pool and it is easy to spend hours there without noticing! Fitness Room Used the fitness room several times. There are 3 Treadmills. For the entire stay, 2 out of 3 Treadmills had a 'Maintenance sticker' on it and was not functional. Obviously the hotel did not care to be prompt about repairing broken equipment. Something that is so commonly used as a Treadmill that sits around without being maintained for days is inexcusable.

We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel, Sanur for 6 nights which was magnificent. The room was incredible, the pool area stunning, the service perfect, and the pool area to die for. The 40m blue infinity pool looking out to the sea was lovely to lounge around and gave us the opportunity for great swims - well, before the unfortunate accident, anyway. The room was so luxurious with a huge bathroom, a big bedroom with a super comfortable bed and pillows, and the biggest, loveliest balcony which was really an al fresco room looking out to the gardens and beyond to the sea. This was especially appreciated after the unfortunate accident. Breakfast at the Layang Layang Restaurant was superb. Lavish, high quality buffet but also a la carte off a creative menu if you liked. Unbelievable everything - just the variety of expensive French cheese was enough to reel me in but the choice was excellent, including a very authentic Indonesian corner, and the gorgeous, classy restaurant was run really well by Andrini. Please see attached video! The three course delicious meal in the hotel‚Äôs beach restaurant attended by Ima was fantastic and the two 60 minute massages at the exclusive and posh spa were the same. I actually cried because I felt so cared for. But the Travel Moment of the trip was the ‚Äòsunrise boat breakfast‚Äô. We went down to the beach at 5.30am in the dark and hopped into one of the little, local, coloured boats that look like spiders. A beautiful breakfast spread had been prepared and put on a big tray on a block in the middle of the boat and it wasn‚Äôt long before we gently motored out through the reef markers to ‚Äòchase the sunrise‚Äô. We were so lucky the weather was so calm, especially after the storm the day before that uprooted trees. It was so intimately special watching the sunrise as the lights of familiar territory along the Sanur strip turned into places we could identify. We even saw a turtle! I can‚Äôt believe I have been holidaying in Sanur for 40 years and have never been out in a local boat before! And then the unfortunate accident happened. My partner went over on his ankle as he crossed the road and twisted to look for traffic. Unable to put any weight on it, we taxied home in despair. The Intercontinental was most sympathetic, providing us with the use of a wheelchair and keeping our spirits up with chocolate mousse cake and fruit to our room. I want to make special mention of Concierge Kurnia who would present even at breakfast and work magic for any query or request we had. Yoga and Tomy were great Reception managers - always very helpful and friendly. All of the staff, without exception were very, very good indeed. Nothing was too much trouble. The location is just perfect, right on the beach path which runs along the beach north and south with lots of little local bars, restaurants and music places. Alternatively the little road the hotel drive is down comes off Jalan Tambligan with lots of shops, restaurants and such. All the guests we talked to were glowing in their opinion of the Intercontinental. I say just go. You won‚Äôt regret it at all. We‚Äôll certainly be hopping on the next special that comes up! Loved it!
The tv should be placed facing the bed. The overall is good, the bed is so comfortable, the ambiance was so great as well. last but not least, birthday decoration & the surprise is good

Something went wrong with this hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, but the service is a fail. We had to wait for our room to get ready for 2.5 hours after the proposed check in time , because the hotel could not keep up with cleaning the rooms. The shower walls were very mouldy, it looks as if it was never properly cleaned. Then the bathroom was broken, then couldn't get into the gym, then had to wait for the pool to be open at 8, unless you go to the reception and ask about it. The reception doesn't pick up the phone when you need them. On the check out we were given the wrong invoice. The staff in a restaurant is lovely, but that's about it. The options are limited and the food that supposed to be hot was cold and unpleasant. Won't stay here again

We stayed at the Intercontinental Bali Sanur and it was the worst 6 nights of our Bali holiday. On arrival our check in was 3pm only to be made to wait an hour for our 3 bedroom Villa (Villa 805). The kitchen fridge had mould throughout. The master cupboard had mould in it. The doors to the pool didn‚Äôt lock. The deck was badly maintained and had rotten timber which was extremely dangerous. To top off our stay we had items of clothing stolen out of our luggage. For the amount of money we paid I would never stay or recommend this hotel. Extremely disappointing.

Great location and right on the beach and next to all the action. Breakfast spread amazing, very friendly staff..special mention of Ms Amel and Ms Ayu.. great job üëè We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, highly recommend this hotel

We loved our 10 days in our 1-bedroom ocean view room. Our room was huge with a large comfy outdoor room with beautiful views. While rooms are now being renovated our room was still of a very high standard, immaculately clean and serviced daily. The Layang Layang restaurant is outstanding - amazing breakfast options, lovely for dinner and gorgeous decor. A great kitchen! We love the traditional and relaxed feel of the hotel, large infinity pool and stunning gardens. We also enjoyed several visits to the spa! We can‚Äôt speak highly enough of ALL staff who were so helpful and friendly. This hotel is right on the beach with great access to good shopping, cafes and restaurants in a quieter family area of Bali. Highly recommended.

Worst experience staying here, if you are planning to stay here, I suggest you CHOOSE ANOTHER HOTEL with the same price but you will have a more pleasant experience. 1. The water in the bathroom was so dirty that I sometimes came out black. 2. Hot water that does not work, 3. There are many mosquitoes and flies when entering the room. 4. The interior of the room is quite old so it seems dusty and dirty. Service is very different from other hotels in the same class. Very unmemorable stay here.

I am absolutely outraged by the breakfast experience at the Intercontinental Hotel. The meal was shockingly subpar‚Äînothing like the refined, high-quality fare I expect from a 5-star establishment. Instead of a luxurious spread, I was served food that resembled nothing more than cafeteria fare. Considering the nearly $300 nightly rate, this is completely unacceptable. The hotel‚Äôs excuse‚Äîthat the back dining area is under renovation‚Äîdoes nothing to justify this drastic drop in quality. Food should speak for itself, regardless of the surroundings, and there was no mention of any such closure when I booked online. I feel utterly deceived and cheated, as if I was lured into a stay under false pretenses. This has been the worst nightmare of a morning, and it leaves me seething with disappointment and anger. The issues with this hotel seem endless. I tried to use the fitness center, but the key card wouldn‚Äôt work, which left me completely confused. To make matters worse, the bathroom near the pool, which only has one toilet, was broken. As a result, I had to walk all the way back to the main building just to use the restroom ‚Äì something that should never have happened. Additionally, the water here is dirty. I really don‚Äôt understand how they have the nerve to charge full price for a room when their service is clearly lacking. Everything looks unkempt, closed off, and unprepared. It‚Äôs incredibly disappointing.

I recently stayed at InterContinental Bali Sanur Resort and it was a letdown. My room had a lot of ants, especially on the mattress and bathroom, which was really gross. I told the staff, but they didn‚Äôt fix it. We couldn‚Äôt enjoy our stay at all, especially since it was late at night. I‚Äôve used this brand in other countries without issues, so I expected better. They haven‚Äôt offered any compensation for the trouble, which is really disappointing. I definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hotel.

Hotel is under renovation but everybody pretends nothing is happening. I'm staying here now and my room lock stopped working. It took the staff over 1h to fix the lock. In the process they let in a very large lizard into the room ceiling, which pest control was unable to find. A new room was only on the table when I insisted. The staff suggested we stay in the room after pest control setup a trap in the room. I have 2 young kids. It then took the staff over 1h to prepare a new room to transfer to. No efforts are being made to make things right. All this nonsense took up half a day from my precious family holiday time. In general, the main restaurant is closed. Many small things don't work around the resort. Breakfast location is full of flies. It's a well located resort with good bones but just a painfully awful experience when you need the staff to step up to make up for all the renovation disturbances. I highly recommend going elsewhere.

The hotel was very bad! We had made a reservation through Booking.com. We checked into the hotel in the evening, and the next day after inspecting the hotel we wanted to leave. There was mold in our room. The breakfast was very bad. The beach had 4-5 sun loungers and was quite unkempt. The hotel was general unkempt. There was renovation work going on in the hotel and it was quite noisy. For people like us who had traveled 12,000 km and had come to Bali for a vacation, this was unacceptable. Nothing in the pictures matched the reality there. After we decided that we wanted to leave, we informed the reception, where they informed us that we had to pay the full amount for the entire stay and that way we could leave. I understand that this is their policy, but nowhere in the hotel description was it mentioned that it would be dirty and noisy in the hotel. After repeated calls and conversations with booking operators, they explained to us that they might refund some of our money. We paid and left the hotel. We were very disappointed! And after our repeated emails, no one gave us any money back! Don't stay there!

I just checked into the InterContinental Bali Sanur Resort and feel compelled to share my initial impressions. Unfortunately, the experience has been disappointing and does not align with the hotel‚Äôs five-star rating. I had requested an early check-in, and the staff initially responded, indicating they would try their best to accommodate. Had a lovely week here. Spacious well appointed suite was like living in a very cool museum. The location was excellent for exploring on foot but on-site, quiet and relaxed. Absolutely the worst hotel experience in my life. Found a giant cockroach in my suitcase one day I got back. Changed room to sleep and saw a huge fly on the towel. got upgrading to One Bedroom Suite Ocean View.... The room itself was nice but took time for air con to fill up whole room.. The room is on 3rd floor, so the ocean view is not so ideal. Anyway, the beach in front of the hotel is not nice for swimming since it's short and a lot of boats there

Everything was great The location was great the beach the acitivities and mostly which is important at a hotel the welcoming and loving staff. Rooms are spacious Breakfast is great

Overall great, friendly staff and well managed. The location is also good with some great beach bars and restaurants nearby. Perfect service amazing views comfortable rooms. And the wall plugs can be used by and port internationally. Perfect hotel did I mention the service holy moly it was amazing service

We stayed at the Intercontinental Sanur for 4 nights in April. The service by staff was brilliant, location is really great and our kids loved the kids club. However we found the resort to be tired and in need of quite a bit of maintenance. The pool had this tape up the whole time we were there which takes away from the lovely view, the pool towels were old and the furniture had seen better days as well as not being much of it around the pool. This is a very nice hotel in a great location. We are staying for 3 nights. I have already left a honest review on trip advisor and I wanted to add an update to that review, unfortunately trip advisor won‚Äôt allow me to do this so I‚Äôm am doing it here instead. We checked in on our first day, had a look around then spent some time at the pool. On returning to our suite my wife took a shower, only for the bathroom to flood, leaving approximately 10mm of water all over the bathroom floor, spreading out into the hallway and towards the main room and the exit door. I had to call reception 3 times over around a 30 minute period before any help arrived. The housekeeping staff were excellent in cleaning up but it took a while to get any managerial response. After one night in the new room we noticed a smell in the bathroom, a bit sewage like and then suddenly all the power in the room went down. This was meant to be the calm before our long journey home after a fabulous Bali experience but alas it‚Äôs not been the case. We stayed here for one night and were pretty disappointed. The hotel was not as expected. On the 3rd August we abandoned our 6 night stay at Intercontinental Sanur after just 3 hours in the room. This hotel is in an absolute state of disrepair, everywhere you look - it has been neglected and it is at the end of its life as a hotel. The pictures online are NOT how it is now at all - perhaps 10 years ago, but they are not a true reflection by any stretch. Structures in the imagery online do not even exist now - do not trust what you see. We first checked in early and our room wasn‚Äôt ready which was no problem - we were shown to the pool and a few alarm bells rang given the state of the facilities - the tiles falling off walls, the collapsing ground around the pools and so much more - I cannot stress how bad the condition of this hotel actually is and we are very frequent travellers. This was our third week in Bali and we have been for 4 resorts prior - the Intercontinental classes itself as 5 star but this place is absolutely not - perhaps at best, 3 stars. When our room was ready, we were taken there and we could not believe the state of the corridors, the elevators were not even operational and it‚Äôs clear that they had not been for some time. The room itself from first looks was not that bad, but the red flag was the deck railing was broken from all bottom mounts completely from rust, if you lent on it you risked falling off (we were 3rd floor) and there was no way we were willing to stay 6 nights with a 4 year old in that environment. The duty manager was very understanding and he himself agreed that the hotel was not safe. Credit to him and the other staff, I feel for them having to represent a property that clearly the owners have no interest in maintaining. We have stayed at several intercontinental hotels before and this falls short beyond belief - this would be a 3 star hotel at very, very best. We are awaiting a full refund that was promised - it has now been 5 working days and nothing, which our bank says is not right. Beyond disappointed, don‚Äôt end up in the same position, do not book this hotel.

Our recent stay at Intercontinental Hotel Sanur was a delightful experience overall. From the moment of arrival, I was warmly welcomed by the attentive staff, setting the tone for a pleasant stay. The hotel's convenient parking facilities made it easy to settle in. One of the highlights was the exceptional service provided by the staff throughout the hotel. They were consistently friendly, accommodating, and went above and beyond to ensure my comfort. The room was large, clean and the balcony was amazing, very nice for mum and dad to spend time there while kids are asleep. The hotel boasts a good selection of restaurants offering delicious cuisine. I particularly enjoyed dining at Pier Eight where the food was of excellent quality and the atmosphere was perfect for family dining. Families traveling with children will appreciate the reasonably good kids club facilities, providing entertainment and activities for younger guests. Intercontinental Hotel Sanur's location is another advantage, being close to an array of restaurants and attractions that Sanur has to offer. It was convenient to explore the area and enjoy the local dining scene. However, a major downside was the disappointing pool design. Despite being an infinity pool, the ocean views obstructed completely by trees, detracting from the overall point of it. Additionally, there were not enough shaded areas or seats around the pool, making it challenging to find a comfortable spot to relax. The kids' pool being isolated/positioned elsewhere was also very inconvenient. The property sprawls across expansive grounds with ample gardens and open space, yet much of it remains underutilised. The pool is located quite a distance from the rooms, requiring a considerable walk to access. Additionally, given we paid close to $500 per night, it was disappointing to see that the hotel is in need of significant maintenance and upkeep such as tap wear, electrical, etc throughout its premises. Overall, our stay at Intercontinental Hotel Sanur was enjoyable, thanks to the excellent service, good dining options, and convenient location. However, improvements to the pool area and the hotel in general would enhance the overall guest experience.
Beautiful luxurious resort and facilities, Yoga Front office and his team was great at his customers service and hosting us

We were given complimentary afternoon tea to compensate the underwhelming experience, but really I'd just rather a clean, comfortable and sound proofed room and that shouldn't be much to ask for in a 5 star hotel.

Stayed for 5 nights in a Suite. Love, love, love this place. Service was excellent from all staff we interacted with. The pool is fabulous and the pool team were very attentive. We arw staying again so thank you for your excellent service !

The beds are incredibly comfortable and the bathrooms and balconies are super spacious. My favorite was the beach side restaurant Pier 8. Great food and comfortable seating, all right next to the sea. Great breeze. Our waitress, Novita was a star!!!!

Sent feedback to resort and the reply was we will use your comments to coach our team in order to provide a better experience in the future. Assume a similar one will appear below this.... Lip services so making a public review for others now so they arent ripped off.

The food is delicious and the breakfast changes slightly every day. There weren't many people in the pool, so it was very nice to swim. Thank you to all the staff for being so friendly.

Dining experience at the pier eight found very disappointing, the staff not attentive. We are four they provide napkins only 2 until we have to request extra. We request tabasco received almost the empty bottle, ice cream dessert send with fork untill we complaint ask for correct spoon but given big spoon. Unbelievable!

My Wife & I recently stayed 7 nights in a Junior Suite Ocean View room to celebrate our wedding Anniversary. Check in was pleasant, welcoming and friendly. Our newly renovated room was Spacious, Clean and had all the luxuries you would expect of an Intercontinental Hotel. The large balcony was used every day to relax, listen to music and read a book. Breakfast was beautiful, made to order eggs, 5 different ways and there was nothing more you could have wished for. The Staff were very happy and friendly, by our second morning they were greeting us by our names. Afternoon drinks in the lobby were great and the live music was a very cool way to enjoy sunset. We were very fortunate the Hotel was not busy and most afternoons we had the Pool to ourselves. The Pool Staff were attentive to whatever we required - iced water, cocktails, beers, nothing was too much effort. We ate twice at the Peir Eight Bar on the beach, Yanti made us very welcome, and our service was amazing - both nights we ate dinner on the beach with our feet in the sand. Yanti also organized our Jukung Floating Breakfast out on the boat. We watched the sunrise while eating our pastries and drinking coffee and tea, this was another activity the Hotel offered, and we were both extremely glad we did it. We would like to take this opportunity to thank all the Staff at Intercontinental Bal Sanur Resort for their hospitality and service and would recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for beautiful week in Sanur.

We had the most beautiful 7 nights here. You feel relaxed and welcome the minute you arrive. The rooms are so big, clean and comfortable, the gardens and pools are great. The staff are exceptional and will do everything they can to help you, nothing is every a worry or too hard. The food is freh and delicious and the breakfast is great, it is fabulous having buffet and a la carte options. The java noodles on room service will change your life and the coffee at breakfast is probably the best I have had in Bali. Beach access out the back is straight onto the pathway and the beach is lovely. It is in a corner of the bay so seaweed collects but literally 50m up the beach it is fine. Kids activities are great the bonfire marshmellows, firedancing and kite making were a big hit. It seems a lot of the negative reviews, focus on the little things. Yes there are some parts of the hotel that need a bit of repair, like missing letters on signs and the water pressure in the shower is not fantastic but these are minor details and I choose not to focus on them. It is lear things are always being repaired and worked on and I am yet to find a hotel in Bali which is 100% immaculate. My only small piece of feedback would be to fix the waterfeatures on some of the ponds as the stangant water does attract mosquitos but they have people cleaning it out every day. Overall the value for money given the location, sheer size and luxury of the rooms, quality of food, staff and the pools is really very good. If you want a cheaper hotel in this area, you will be away from the beach, in a much shabbier hotel or in a room 1/3 the size. Thank you for a beautiful stay and so many lovely memories.

The price is reasonable compared to other famouse hotel. I ordered extra bed the quality was great. They visited several times a day to clean our room. They served free drinks everyday 5-7pm. (2cocktails per person) There is a free photograph program too. breakfast buffet was good but the vegetable was not fresh. And the pool is not attached to the beach. You have to go upstairs to reach there. Except some disadvantages, the location was nice and every staff was kind.

The hotel is ideally located right on the beach, with quick access to the promenade. The ocean view is great ! Rooms are spacious and bedding is pleasant. The overall experience is ok for a hotel in Bali. However, it's not up to that of a 5-star hotel. Having stayed at the Indigo Seminyak a few days earlier, with a great experience, it's hard to imagine that the InterContinental Sanur is part of the same hotel group, IHG. For a better experience, the hotel needs to improve on room maintenance (e.g. cleanliness of walls, see picture room 416) and common areas (e.g. more regular cleaning of pool toilets). As for the pool experience, the cocktails and service are top-notch, but the welcome can be improved. Setting up the guests' bed seems more appropriate for a 5-star hotel than handing them towels to find a seat. I hope this comment will help the hotel to offer a better experience to future guests.

The rooms are huge. That‚Äôs the biggest plus, there definitely needs more maintenance in the rooms and around the resort. Breakfast was okay, actually very good tasting food just maybe lacked the variety that I am used to at other hotels in bali.
Hotel yg cukup bagus di area Sanur dengan pemandangan sunrise yg begitu indah, serta ada joging track di depan pantai, view nya juga cakep sekali.

We brought in the New Year at the Intercontinental Sanur. We stayed in the Ocean View Suite for 3 nights. Hugeeee room and excellent location. The service at this resort was amazing! Pool was fabulous and very quiet. Breakfast delicious. Really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely return.

We have had an amazing time, thank you to all the staff who made us feel so welcome. We got more than we expected. The room has been outstanding and the location has so much to offer and we weee spoiled for choice in every way. We will be back! Xx

We had issue inn our first night staying here that our room (212) was leaking on ceiling and we had to move to other room yet with unpleasant smell (unfresh air). they said that odour of the replacement room coming from ac that was just turn on for us. what an experience! The duty manager came and said sorry for what the problem we got, and gave us more than thousand of member point, we also say thank you on that. We really love stay at Sanur area, but we have to think and take other consider to re-stay at InterContinental Sanur if they still have some issue on what we had on our stay.
11 pm! leaking, flooding. Yupe, thats what it is. dont waste your money staying here. Its definitely not worth it

Spent three nights at Intercontinental. Renovations are quite spectacular with ridiculously hip designer features. Some stunning pieces on display. But its people that make a hotel successful and unfortunately this hotel lacks atmosphere and vibe. It was pretty, but dull. Only half the hotel operational and that unfortunately made for a fairly soulless experience. The staff seem overloaded at times and not particularly happy. Housekeeping a particular problem I suspect with rooms not being serviced until late afternoon and even then only after a phone call to hassle. An empty mini bar and no information or help in how to 'drive' the room. We never mastered the lighting, but soon figured out the toilet eco-wash . LOL! The pool area is lovely, but we were informed we were not allowed to order cocktails poolside which was a bit of a downer on arrival. Two days later we were! Gardens are obviously still being established and water features are still a work in progress. Breakfasts were lovely and so were the restaurant staff. Good coffee and a shout out to the charming Vera. Room was beautifully decorated, but rather dark and moody with brown furnishings and no sunlight penetrating. Super comfy bed! Rough garden outside the shade cloth blind, so not a nice outlook. Great bathroom. Would have liked a stocked bar fridge and some brochures/info. A printed room service menu is preferable to using a QR code to get into TV menu. I'm on holiday - I want stuff to be quick and easily accessible.

What we liked: 1. Big rooms with huge airy balconies where we can spend time without air-conditioning. 2. Strong water pressure in the shower. 3. Rain showers. 4. We can actually set the temperature in the rooms. 5. Lovely polite staff, always offering to help. 6. Wide vegetarian and vegan options in the breakfast buffet with a good choice of nuts. 7. Free (flow) cocktails from 5-6pm at the hotel‚Äôs Pier 8 beach side restaurant. 8. Complimentary Snacks and drinks all day at the lobby. 9. Plenty of hooks in the bathroom to hang towels, clothes, washed masks. 10. Beautiful views from the balcony. What we would have preferred: 1. Covered walkways all the way to the beach and the hotel‚Äôs Pier 8 restaurant by the beach. It rains a lot on Dec, and having to walk in the rain isn‚Äôt pleasant when it gets heavy. 2. Well maintained and IHG branded umbrellas. The umbrellas we loaned were a mish mash of design, although they were certainly large enough. 3. Replace broken furniture in the rooms / bathroom. Our bathroom in 421 had a pedestal by the bathtub that was cracked and had sharp edges and looked out of place in the otherwise clean and well designed bathroom. See pic. The metal grills in the balcony also couldn‚Äôt open fully as the left side was stuck, and was left stuck throughout our stay even though the staff knew about it. 4. Let the guests know where the shampoo, shower gel and body lotion came from. They were simply labeled ‚Äúshampoo‚Äù, ‚Äúshower‚Äù and ‚Äúbody lotion‚Äù and were unbranded, which is surprising for an Intercontinental. 5. If hotel activities could carry on as scheduled. We wanted to attend the Jazz night at Pier 8 on Fri evening. After braving the rain, we were told by the Pier 8 staff that there wasn‚Äôt going to be live music and the piped music would just be pop. As we left we could see that they had set up the keyboard and microphone for live music, and there appeared to be 2 dresses musicians just sitting there scrolling thru their phones and smoking. Overall a great stay. For the price we paid, the hotel could have paid more attention to maintenance details.

I would definitely not come again. It‚Äôs not worth the high price. Very old rooms, aircon makes everything wet. Food in the restaurant was very slow, my wife got sick from the food as well. Not what you expect from a 5 star resort, better look for a different type place to stay!

We had a memorable stay at Intercontinental Sanur all thanks to Rama, Justin Angelina and Raka for making sure our room is clean and surprising us with little surprises throughout our stay from 25-30 May 2024. The check-in was seamless. The rooms are spacious and even have zipped tracked to block out insects and the heat on a sunny day, and yet enable us to enjoy the fresh Bali air with privacy. The hotel is just beside the beach which has intertidal zone during low tide which my son absolutely loves. They have a section of the sea cordoned off so that boats do not park in that area, which allows guests to swim or soak in the sea during high tide. It is safe as the big waves are further out. Intercontinental Sanur also has a functional Kids Club where it is well furnished with a little tree house, toys, books and crafts for all ages. We also enjoyed our daily breakfasts at Layang Layang restaurant which has both alfresco and indoor dining. They have a wide variety of cuisines to choose from and my favorite is the fruits and freshly squeezed juices selections. A great thank you to Andrini, Artini, April and Alvis as well - you guys make the A Team.

Avoid staying here at least until the renovations are complete. Was awoken at 08:00 during my stay by hammering and grinding sounds. Not a great hotel considering they are charging the same amount as other much more luxurious hotels in Nusa Dua. No loyalty recognition as IHG Platinum on check-in, no late check-out offered and when asked the latest they can do is 1pm despite the hotel being seemingly quiet. Rooms look tired, no fruit on arrival, only 2 bottles of water given per day, power points next to the bed dont work, no espresso machine in the room, bathrooms have not been refreshed in many years, and beds are so soft my partner and I woke up with sore backs in the mornings. There was also white mould growing in the bathroom (see pic attached to this review) ‚Äî not great for a 5 star hotel. The pros is that the balcony area of the Junior Suite is lovely and quite private, the hotel currently offers 2 free drinks per person per day at the lobby lounge bar, and all the interactions with staff were friendly and positive. Based on the value for money, lack of status recognition, and current issues with the property, I won't be returning.

Very nice hotel. Although they are still finishing up the remaining renovation, service is already at a very good level. Breakfast is awesome and the location could not be much better with easy access to the beach and some very good restaurants. The only but is, that although some parts are supposed to be freshly renovated, it already looks a little worn out ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

We just went for high tea but it was superb. Can‚Äôt comment on rooms but location is great, staff were super nice. It‚Äôs quite pricey so I‚Äôm sure the rooms & facilities are lovely. If I win Lotto I‚Äôll stay there!

Amazing place with good location. Spacious room with balcony, cool aircon, great in-room services with a TV that has access to multiple channels. Layang-layang restaurant has pretty tasty food, lots of variety catering to halal options. Gym facility is alright, multiple treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbbells and machines for all muscle groups. Staff of IBSR are very friendly and attentive. They make us feel welcomed and are ready to assist in anyway they can. One example like Angel, a trainee in the hotel that has initiative. While at the beach area, she happily agreed to take care of our drinks and handphones as we head to the sea. Also kindly offered iced water for us after the walk. All the best to her future endeavors. Great experience overall. üëç

Had a great experience staying with them. Old but well maintained and still stylish at the same time.. luxury meet tranquility and local vibe. Check in was a bit of a problem, didnt come early but room is still not available, so we were asked to wait in the lobby area presented with a complimentary high tea, very much appreciated.. after around 40 mins of enjoying our meal with live piano on the background, we were told that our room is ready. Big spacious room, facing the sea, beautiful view. Beaitiful room. Nice comfy bed, nice pillow as well. Bathroom is also spacious with nice bath tub. Amenities were also great. Spacious terrace with great seating area. Perfect room.. Breakfast was great, they have both buffet and a la carte menu that we can choose from. Enjoyed it a lot. Pool was big enough to swim around and enjoy the view. The hotel also provided a free cocktail during certain hours at the hotel's bar.. perfect!!
Restaurant staff and Banquet team are all friendly. They offered amazingly Great services. Food were delicious and dessert are not too sweet which is perfect üëå

New management and ownership do not value their guests and fail to treat them with even a modicum of hospitality. I had a re-booking guarantee made with the property stemming from COVID restrictions that made it impossible to enter Bali on the original stay dates. Not only did new management refuse to honour the original terms of the promise, they arbitrarily imposed additional restrictions on them without any warning or consultation. Only when I called them out on this by providing the original correspondence did they remove these additional restrictions (still refusing to honour the original agreement) while acting as if they were doing me some big favour. I should have just refunded in full through my insurance when I had the opportunity but I thought there would be no issues as I was dealing with a high end hotel brand. Big mistake on my part. I will never book this property again and would suggest others to do the same, Sanur has so many better hotels who will go above and beyond to make your stay pleasant.

We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of April 2022 and had a pleasant stay. Only 1 of their three restaurants was open and the spa was also closed, we were surprised by this as we didn‚Äôt see that notice on the website. They hosted the spa in one of the private villas instead and ran a good promotion so that made up for the closure. The grounds and facilities are quite beautiful but it seemed like they were short on staff as some areas were unkept/unclean. The beach-area was ok, although we would have expected to see it better maintained. Pool was fantastic we sat here everyday but again, could have been maintained better as there was a ring of green algae around the edge of the pool. The room was nice and definitely had 5 star potential, but the bathroom- specifically the shower was dirty. We would have also expected a spa menu/dining menu/hotel info booklet in the room. Overall we would stay here again as it seems like they are putting in the effort to get up and running after the pandemic.

Me and my extended family had an excellent stay at The Intercontinental. From start to finish the staff were amazing and accommodated every request, often going above and beyond our expectations. We were all there for a special event, and the staff even organized a private turtle release for us which was amazing! The rooms, service, food, and drinks were top notch. Already missing our stay. Thank you!

We arrived on Thursday 8Feb24 noon for 3N stay, met FO officer Tomy who assisted us warmly and promptly üëçüèªüëçüèª thank you Tomy üå∏ As we entered the room of Junior suite - 311, the suite is super super spacious, about 90 square meter I guess and as 3 adults stay here, the HK also set the extra bed for our daughter. Nothing to be complained about from the bed area, the balcony and the bathroom area. All amenities as expected, presented perfectly. We feel it is a blessing as the balcony has the nice view of Sanur sea and we can smell the natural frangipane fragrance from all frangipane trees planted at the garden and sounds of birds chirping. Keep up the good work üëçüèª

Newly re-open and re-branding hotel. The staff are friendly and attentive. The room is nice with a separate semi open air living room. One TV was missing in the living room but it's ok. The Sanur beach is just at the back of the hotel. Great access for jogging and walking. The swimming pool is nice. Some rooms are still refurbished.

I stayed here for two weeks with my wife and two young boys. We would highly recommend the hotel. We particularly loved the friendly staff throughout. Other highlights were breakfast, the kids club and the lovely Rini and Laksmi, the beachfront location and the gym. There is a huge infinity pool and two small pools. There are no features for kids as such but plenty of space to splash around without disturbing other guests. Sanur is a great location to base yourself with kids. Right out the front of the hotel is a nice beach with loads of restaurants and bars. The walkway stretches many kms.

We initially booked 3 rooms, but upon finding out there is villa available, i asked if i could cancel my room reservation and rebook to villa. The hotel was kind enough to just upgrade it for me. The hotel is well located with Sanur beach just at the back of the hotel. Some rooms and villas are still under renovation (not sure mine is renovated already or not, but i would guess not. Yet it still look fantastic). And as i always experience, excellent IHG service. When we were checked in already, the manager in duty came to our villa in the late afternoon, introduced himself, and apologise in advance for all the renovation work around the area which might bother us.
Alika was lovely, she booked a driver for us when our driver didnt arrive. PLEASE THANK HER!!!!

1st trip to Baliüó∫, Actually it took half a day to settle at this hotelüè® Its located just in front of the beach...all ticks for anyone who is considering beach sereneüèñ Size of the Accomodationüö™ - Absolutely big, large sitting verandah space overlooking beach, large elegant ensuite including everything..i loved it Food at Pier Eight - continental buffet bfast, all say service for lunch, dinner and drinks. I feel I need to start by saying that this is not a reflection on the staff at this hotel. It‚Äôs the hotel itself and how I didn‚Äôt feel like I got the intercontinental experience I was hoping for. I had also just come from an 8 night stay at another hotel (The Anvaya in Kuta) and was coming to the IC for 3 days of luxury & quiet, however the Anvaya was far nicer and lived closer to my IC expectations. I have also stayed at the IC in Jimbaran Bay and this hotel does not come close to being at the same standard. We didn‚Äôt get off to a great start, when the room key didn‚Äôt open the door when we first arrived and then on departure day (around 08:00) I asked about my guaranteed 4pm late check out, said they would check as someone was booked in our room after us. Didn‚Äôt get an answer so went back to reception at 12:30 to check, all ok to keep room until 4pm. But then our key didn‚Äôt work when trying to access at 14:30! Back to reception to get that fixed! Attention to detail is lacking, for example missing letters from signs; no real IC branding or vibe; large temple/water feature laying stagnant & brown, in fact, very few water feature seems to be working. Room is lovely and large with the biggest balcony I have ever seen! However the shower pressure is so bad; I would go as far to say it‚Äôs the worst shower I have ever had! This must have been our room specificity, as the shower room we had in the evening was fine. First morning we could smell smoke at 4:30am coming from a bonfire outside of the hotel & the smell was seeping into room. Reception gave us an oil burner for the room, happened on first night which was really bad and our last night which was much lighter. (We stayed 3 nights in total!) Staff were all very lovely and courteous. The hotel was not overly busy, which allowed them to remember room numbers of guests when ordering drinks or food. Pros: - Breakfast included- however not as many options as IC in Jimbarron Bay (breakfast not included) or other Bali hotels I have stayed in - Great location. Plenty of outside restaurants both on the street and beach - Was given 1000 extra IHG points due to construction and also given a free cocktail in the lounge bar from 5-7pm - Nice and quiet around the pool. No loud music or entertainment. Large wide sunbeds and even couples double beds. Iced cold water served at pool when you arrive - Nice seating area around pool if you want to eat or drink without leave the pool area and have causal dining (rather than sitting on your sunbed) Cons: - Under construction so quite noisy in the daytime - Hot water pressure very poor in shower, told reception but still no change, which we were not surprised about. This really did make for a bad experience - Huge orchid statue around the pool blocking the view. Also a bit of an eyesore and not the greatest looking piece - Online beverage menu for pier eight has incorrect pricing, it‚Äôs actually higher - Does not have a tv room or waiting area if your flight is delayed or later in the evening. They did however allow for us to book a room to have a quick shower Overall, I probably wouldn‚Äôt stay at this hotel again, not at least until after the renovations and even then I think if I stay in Sanur again, I‚Äôd try somewhere else or I‚Äôd stay at IC in Jimbaran Bay.

Generally disappointing experience. Don't expect a 5 star experience. Check in was ok. Staff is nice, polite, earnest and attentive as usual in Bali. The receptionist wasn't sure if my booking under the Amex Hotel Collection qualified for points or if I should get an upgrade because of my IHG Diamond + Intercontinental Ambassador status. I didn't get anything in the end. I got a garden view upgrade to the 3rd floor but it didn't really seem like an upgrade when I walked around the property most of the first floor rooms had open doors and construction going on anyway. But that's fine as I didn't know the full terms of the Amex hotel collection booking either. The room was fine mostly. But the bathtub was broken (the stopper was stuck in and wouldn't let water drain). They spent some hours in my room to fix this so I had to work in the pool cafe but then they had a children's practice dance out of nowhere. Didn't seem like a performance put up for guests but some external usage of the space? Finally, more than half the hotel is under renovation due to I imagine covid so quite a bit of the property is derelict or in disrepair. You will walk past walls with peeling paint, rotting wood, staircases and walkways with no lighting or lighting fixtures with bare sockets and many rooms under construction and workers milling about. Most of the gardens seem to be maintained but some areas look neglected. The pool has some beds that are in disrepair and need replacing. See photo. The fabric is totally frayed and torn off. Haven't been to a 5 star hotel before that had furniture looking like this. I think the flower sculpture is also a bit weird looking and out of place with the aesthetic of the place. Finally, the breakfast. It's ok mostly but I ate a tomato the last morning that seemed a bit.. off. Additionally many of the fruit station had fruit flies buzzing, which I suppose is natural. I asked when the renovations and upgrading would be completed. They didn't know. I suppose you'd want to hold off on staying at this property until that's completed fully. I don't think the property owners should be selling rooms when the property is in this state, honestly speaking.

Unbelievably, this is the worst InterContinental Hotel I have ever stayed in. It‚Äôs my honeymoon trip but I‚Äôm so disappointed. Inoperable Lights: when we try to sleep, I discovered that the one light could not be turned off. Stained Sheets: the bed sheets were visibly stained. As a guest, I expect clean and well-maintained linens, and this oversight was unacceptable. Front Desk Communication Failure: When I contacted the front desk to request a room change, I was promised a callback. Regrettably, no one followed up, leaving me frustrated and without a resolution. I have to visite the front desk in person, but the response was equally disappointing. Long Wait for Room Change: The front desk informed me that changing rooms would take over an hour due to cleaning procedures(Funny, 11:30 PM NOW). Considering our late arrival (after a long day of travel), this delay was highly inconvenient. Exhaustion and Sleep Deprivation: My wife and I were exhausted from our journey, having visited Mt Bromo at 1 a.m. and then traveled to Bali. By the time we arrived at the hotel around 9PM and trying to go to bed (around 11:30 p.m.), we were desperate for rest. Unfortunately, the prolonged wait for a room change prevented us from getting the rest we desperately needed. Reluctance to Disturb My Wife: Despite the inconvenience, I cant sleep while with light on, but I chose not to wake my wife to change rooms. She was already asleep, and I didn‚Äôt want to disturb her further. Consequently, I endured an uncomfortable situation.

We have just been here for our honeymoon and would like to highlight a few things that we really liked. The room was very nice and spacey, roomservice took good care and always made us nice animals from Towels and put flowers all over. We were welcomed very nicely with flowers all over our bed, a cake and lots of nice gestures from the staff. All workers there are super friendly and they all remembered my name after day two. I would like to also highlight a worker named ‚ÄûRegie‚Äú. This man went out of his way to make our stay a special one. He was always so happy and full of energy and always made any wish come true. There is no waiting with Regie, he gets it done immediately. Even after we had booked out he helped us find a room To shower before our long flight, which was so relieving. I am very thankful for this man and will come back to this hotel for sure, when I come back to Bali. The restaurants provide good food, all of it fresh and tasty. There are not tons of meals that you can choose, but more than enough to eat something else any day. There is also a good mix of local cuisine and western cuisine. We are super happy that we chose this hotel for our 14 days of honeymoon.

This genuinely IS a place worth all five stars. Opulence in the rooms, friendly and helpful staff, literally has the beach at the gate, surrounded by quality beachfront restaurants, live Balinese and Western music, stunning art works, the best Indonesian hotel breakfast I‚Äôve ever seen, stunning tropical gardens and abundant water features, and my favourite place - the huge, calm swimming pool overlooking the beach at dawn. Special mention to Yanti at the Pier Eight restaurant and bar for really looking after us with local information and great food.

My fianc√© and I stayed at the Intercontinental Sanur in March 2024. The hotel was lovely and the staff were wonderful- all very welcoming and attentive. We completed the Mixology class with Puspa and he was great! We had lots of fun and shared a few laughs, all whilst making some delicious cocktails. We would definitely stay here again.

It is good place to have calm n relaxing vacation - either for solo traveller or with family/ friends / group. This hotel has a beach access and it's amazing view for experience sunrise. Great and friendly staffs.

Amazing and great hotel in sanur Bali, I was inspired by the staff service, building of hotel, green area, sound of sanur wave. That makes me enjoy and forget the life problem. I wish one day to rsvp or book the hotel room. Today my experience was a visit to the hotel spa, that is my first time to feel the spa moments with Balinese song sound and other facilities I really recommend the spa facility, the price is competitive if you compare with other spa in Bali

We had a wonderful and relaxing overnight stay. The staff are pleasant and courteous. We got lots of complimentaries such as free 2 cocktails for each guest and 30-min photo session. The room is spacious and we enjoyed the open-area living room. The place is accessible to nearby restos and other shop. We got the service we paid for. Thank you!

We just spent a week here in the villa as well as one of their suites. We had booked this as a big family holiday (11 people) for 2 years ago when it was still Fairmont but had to delay it due to covid. Intercontinental was nice enough to honour the booking so we had to use it by end of this year. This is the only reason we did not just check out and go somewhere else as it was already paid up. We got there after 3pm and was told the rooms were still not ready but not given a specific reason why. We had 5 kids who had been travelling the whole day already and were just keen to get them settled in. After waiting around for a while and pressing further, then they told us the issue and that they were trying to fix it. We requested they let us check in anyway while they try to fix the issue. We only ended up getting to our room after 4pm. We waited all evening for them to fix the aircond issue but in the end they said it couldn't be fixed and that they had no other room for us so some of us ended up having to sleep in the room with no air-conditioning which was very stuffy. The next day they kept saying they could fix the issue but by afternoon it was clear it wasn't happening so after speaking to the acting GM he then said they can give us the villa next door (which begs the question why this wasn't provided earlier). Overall I'm not sure if the villas have been refurbished yet but we felt the furniture was all quite old and everything just a bit worn. Be aware that the hotel is undergoing major renovations so more than half the hotel is non functional and running at a low capacity. Only one restaurant is functioning (Pier Eight) and the menu is about 80% the same as the in room dining menu. The food is decent enough but for longer stays there is not enough variety. Breakfast buffet was in Layang Layang and was OK. They try their best to rotate the hot food (about 8 options) but other than that the rest are the same and minimal for a 5-star hotel. The main pool is nice and the kids club is good too (although the location is also a bit strange). They had a list of resort activities for the week but when I inquired they weren't actually running it (like the Uluwatu lace workshop). They did have the kite making one though which was great for the kids and the kites really did work. There is beach access but don't expect a nice quiet beach. The hotel is situated between a row of shops and restaurants and there are alot of boats in the water. The beachfront for Hyatt Regency is alot better and quieter with less boats. We spent alot of time at Hyatt Regency for meals since Intercon had limited options and Hyatt Regency is only a 6 minute walk along the beach with a kids menu. There are of course alot of other food options along the whole stretch as well but for a big group like ours it was difficult. To be fair the management is trying hard to bring the resort back to life after covid. They offered F&B credit and a free high tea to make up for all the issues. However I think they are about 2 years out from getting to a 5-star hotel standard.
